attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Swindon council have withdraw funding for fixed cameras. This is clearly an embarrassment for the government and shows that speed cameras are all about revenue.

The government is obviously not going to stop the use of all speed cameras because they simply make too much money. However we would like the government to be honest about their use.

We would also like the government to use statistics based on a national average rather than for a specific area. This will stop the government using "best case scenario" statistics to support speed cameras.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
